title: Hepatitis E
summary: Hepatitis E is inflammation of the liver caused by infection with the hepatitis E virus (HEV);[4][5] it is a type of viral hepatitis.[6] Hepatitis E has mainly a fecal-oral transmission route that is similar to hepatitis A, although the viruses are unrelated.[7][8][9] In retrospect, the earliest known epidemic of hepatitis E occurred in 1955 in New Delhi,[10] but the virus was not isolated until 1983 by Russian scientists investigating an outbreak in Afghanistan.[11] HEV is a positive-sense, single-stranded, nonenveloped, RNA icosahedral virus and one of five known human hepatitis viruses: A, B, C, D, and E.
